com.vividsolutions.jcs.conflate.boundarymatch
Class MatchedShell

java.lang.Object
  com.vividsolutions.jcs.conflate.boundarymatch.MatchedShell
Direct Known Subclasses:
MatchedShellReference, MatchedShellSubject
public abstract class MatchedShell
extends java.lang.Object

The main data structure to represent the outer shell of a polygon that has been matched with one or more other polygons, and computed the adjusted version. It contains the list of matches for the line segments of the edge for the shell. It can also compute adjusted indicators for segments and vertices

MatchedShell and its associated classes model the components of the polygon shells in the Subject and Reference datasets. The main objective of the Boundary Matching algorithm is to adjust the Subject to the Reference, while leaving the Reference changed as little as possible. The following are the main design criteris for the Boundary Matching algorithm:

  • Subject shells can have vertices adjusted (moved) and new vertices inserted.
  • Reference shells can have new vertices inserted (optionally, under user control), but their existing vertices are never changed. Insert vertices will lie exactly on the existing edges of the shell (up to numerical precision).
  • NOT YET IMPLEMENTED Subject shells may have vertices that do not appear in the bordering Reference shells deleted (optionally under user control). (This option would be chosen if it desired to match the Subject to the Reference exactly without introducing any new vertices in the Reference.)

getAdjustedVertex

public com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate getAdjustedVertex(int i)
Get the adjusted value of a vertex, if the vertex has been adjusted. Otherwise, return null so that callers can tell that the vertex was not adjusted.

Parameters:
i - the index of the vertex
Returns:
null if the vertex was not adjusted the adjusted coordinate, if there is one

updateAdjustedVertices

public void updateAdjustedVertices()
Default behaviour is to do nothing. Only MatchedShellSubjects may have their vertices adjusted, so only they have an implementation for this method.

computeVertexMatches

public void computeVertexMatches(MatchedShell refShell,
                                 double distanceTolerance)
Compute adjustments to vertices that are within tolerance of a vertex on another shell. Vertices are only adjusted if they are NOT already adjusted (i.e. by a previous segment-segment match)

public com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate[] getAdjusted()

public boolean isAdjustedSegment(int i)
Parameters:
i - the index of the segment to test
Returns:
true if the segment has been adjusted

computeAdjustedEdgeIndicators

public abstract java.util.List computeAdjustedEdgeIndicators()
Computes the adjusted edge indicators.

Returns:
a list of 2-point Coordinate arrays representing the adjusted edges

computeAdjustedVertexIndicators

public java.util.List computeAdjustedVertexIndicators()
Computes the adjusted vertex indicators. Only MatchedShellSubjects implement this method, since only they adjust their vertices

Returns:
a list of 2-point Coordinate arrays defining the adjustment vectors

computeAdjustedShell

public abstract void computeAdjustedShell()
Computes the new shell reflecting any adjustments made to segments and vertices. Updates the value of adjCoord with the new list of points for the shell.
